revised_title: The Influence of Bacterial Endotoxins on Phagocytosis and a New Method for Differentiating Bacteria
tldr: This study investigates the effects of bacterial endotoxins on phagocytosis and develops a new method for differentiating bacteria. The endotoxins were found to inhibit phagocytosis, and the new method demonstrated specificity between closely related organisms, such as the typhoid-paratyphoid group. The endotoxins were also found to be thermostable, maintaining their ability to exert their specific action even after exposure to high temperatures.
